title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, 17 [march? 1869]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 17 [March? 1869]
text: Brooklyn Feb. 1869wensdayWednesday 17dear waltWalti write to say every thing has come all safe your letter with 2 doldollars came on tuesdayTuesday and the dispachDispatch cam about a couple of hours later and the draft came to day wensdayWednesday the dispachdispatch came just as George was going to start to go to PheladelphaPhiladelphia he went with a contract for the foundry men to sign they are to make pipe for the water works i was very glad it came before he left it made him feel much better when he knew you could let him have the money) he had been around to the agents but didentdidn't make out any thing lottLott and several other agents are looking out for him i hope they will suceedsucceed Georgey has had trouble enoughfenough all owing to not getting a loan on smithsSmith's house the houses is both insured and no mortgagmortgage nor nothing on smithsSmith's house it seems almost incredible to tell but so it is) i will get georgeGeorge to doodo what you say) he is having the morgagemortgage made out to Jeffy there will be no other claim on it and i think it has been a good thing for Jeff as well as georgeGeorge i suppose the masons will commence as soon as georgeGeorge comes back which will be to morrow i suppose) i hope you are well waltWalt i dreamed about seeing you last night waltWalt what is it you alluded to that was disagreable in the office) love to OconorsO'Connors and yourselfgood bie walterWalter deari am as well as usual Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 17 [March? 1869]
